cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi W of Port Charlotte FL
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the east-central Gulf, then slowing and turning NNW toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL) late Monday and Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast (around Grand Isle-Ocean Springs corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to AL/FL border westward to Ocean Springs MS – none issued for the Florida east coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS – none for the Florida east coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central & eastern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but not likely (forecast 1-3" with isolated 6" pockets mainly west of Miami)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25-35 mph possible in outer rainbands Sunday; sustained tropical-storm winds not expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-3 inches of rain, locally higher, from outer bands Sunday–Monday; could cause brief urban ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along Atlantic beaches
